title: Bolsheviks
summary: The Bolsheviks (Russian: Большевики, from большинство bolshinstvo, 'majority'),[lower-alpha 1] also known in English as the Bolshevists,[2][lower-alpha 2] were a radical, far-left, and revolutionary Marxist faction founded by Vladimir Lenin that split with the Mensheviks[lower-alpha 3] from the Marxist Russian Social Democratic Labour Party (RSDLP), a revolutionary socialist political party formed in 1898, at its Second Party Congress in 1903.[4]
